titles.title: HP394 Lord Christ, who on thy heart didst bear

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Lord Christ, who on thy heart didst bear
The burden of our shame and sin,
And now on high dost stoop to share
The fight without, the fear within;

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Thy patience cannot know defeat,
Thy pity will not be denied,
Thy loving-kindness still is great,
Thy tender mercies still abide.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
So in our present need we pray
To thee, our living, healing lord,
That we thy people, day by day,
May follow thee and keep thy word;

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
That we may care, as thou hast cared,
For sick and lame, for deaf and blind,
And freely share, as thou hast shared,
In all the sorrows of mankind;

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
That ours may be the holy task
To help and bless, to heal and save;
This is the privilege we ask,
And this the happiness we crave.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
So in thy mercy make us wise,
And lead us in the ways of love,
Until, at last, our wondering eyes
Look on thy glorious face above.
